title: HDFC Bank partners IAF and CSC Academy for veteran initiative
summary:
Mumbai: HDFC Bank has signed an MoU with the Indian Air Force and CSC Academy to launch Project HAKK (Hawai Anubhavi Kalyan Kendra), an initiative aimed at providing financial and administrative support to retired defence personnel and their families.
The initiative will set up 25 centres across Air Force units in cities including New Delhi, Bengaluru, Pune, Secunderabad, Guwahati, Jodhpur, and Chandigarh.The centres will assist veterans and their families with banking, pension-related issues, and essential documentation services.
Tasks such as Aadhaar updates, PAN card applications, passport services, and bill payments, which previously required multiple visits to different offices, can now be completed at these centres.
HDFC Bank, under its Parivartan programme, will also offer skill development and financial training to help veterans and their families manage their finances more effectively.CSC Academy will train individuals to manage the centres, and they will receive a monthly grant for the first year.
The initiative aims to simplify pension and settlement-related processes, ensuring that ex-servicemen and their families can access necessary services more efficiently.

summary:

The company is targeting 'premium' borrowers with unsecured loans of up to Rs 15 lakh, disbursed digitally in 15 minutes.
"We have extensive experience in unsecured lending, with low delinquency rates among top white-collar professionals," said CEO Arvind Kapil.
While the loan is for salaried borrowers the company plans to extend it to self-employed in a few months.
In the aftermath of the pandemic, the Poonawalla group, buoyed by the global recognition of its Covid vaccine and its deep pockets, set its sights on retail lending.
